SENT.plain: Marfan syndrome is a connective tissue disease with typical clinical signs and cardiac involvement
Its appearance in the neonatal period has a bad prognosis due to incompetence of all cardiac valves with subsequent congestive heart failure
Conservative management usually fails, the children die during their first year of life
We report on a girl with neonatal Marfan syndrome who suffered from regurgitance of all cardiac valves, enlarged ventricles, and dilated great arteries
At the age of six months she underwent heart transplantation
To prevent aneurysm formation and dissection of the great vessels, the whole aortic arch and pulmonary trunk were replaced as well
